issue.title: Fixes - May 2022
issue.body:
- [ ] If I open a drop down menu, and then click outside the menu to close it, the element behind is launched. In the example below, if I click to the right or left of the drop down menu to close it, it not only closes the menu but also launches the goal card since I clicked on the card in my attempt to close the menu. Is there a way to make sure that clicking to close the menu doesn't launch the element I click? 

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5ffe1f472e351dd9b643025b/7682bf8a-789c-49bd-bafc-b7377cc7b73a)

pull_request.title: Feature/descw 349 picklist database seeds
pull_request.body:
# Pull Request Considerations

Although some of these things can only be done after merged, please ensure all items have been considered when doing pull requests.

* Updated README.md(s) for new functionality or changes.
* Did you update .env / create a new environment variable?
    * Did you update/create an explanation in the appropriate README.md file for it?
    * Did you make/update an Openshift configmap/secret template for it?
* Have you changed any Openshift configurations/templates?
    * Did you execute the appropriate `oc process` command on the template to put the configmap/secret in openshift?
* Did changes trigger Openshift image rebuilds?
    * Check Openshift instance of application to ensure your changes are working.
* Did you update the changelog CHANGELOG.md. 
    * used to keep track of development changes including (env changes, docker changes, functionality changes)
    * help developers keep track of new/updating changes in code.

pull_request.title: Story/hfi ready toggle db/1859
pull_request.body:
#### New table schema:
```
hfi_ready
- id (uuid, PK)
- hfi_request_id (FK, hfi_request)
- planning_area_id (FK, planning_area)
- ready (boolean)
- create_timestamp (TZ)
- create_user (idir string)
- update_timestamp (TZ)
- update_user (idir string)
```
PK is a UUID because a lot of records are gonna be generated on HFI request changes.
#### Behaviour changes:

Updating a `hfi_request` (fire starts, fuel type, etc), creates a new `hfi_request` and needs to copy over the `hfi_ready` record data, from the updated `hfi_request`, into new `hfi_ready` records that point to the new `hfi_request`

**_Next PR will hook the changes up to responses and handle ready state toggles through API._**

# Test Links:
[Percentile Calculator](https://wps-pr-2049.apps.silver.devops.gov.bc.ca/)
[MoreCast](https://wps-pr-2049.apps.silver.devops.gov.bc.ca/morecast)

issue.title: UI Fixes - Goal Cards
issue.body:
**Description**
Fixes to spacing issues and hierarchy issues for elements of goal cards.

**Actual Results**
- Exiting "Shared with" drop down menu on goal cards by clicking anywhere on the goal card causes the goal card to be launched 
- Buttons on goal cards are not evenly distributed and look messy with new fix of 2 lines
- Dates are long and cause some cards with longer month names to drop down to 2 lines, which misaligns that card to others when window size is reduced

![7682bf8a-789c-49bd-bafc-b7377cc7b73a.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/61e98ff375d0505e601dd00e/0f165d10-4810-4415-aec6-78bd44c0b61b)

![Screen Shot 2022-05-18 at 10.21.10 AM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/61e98ff375d0505e601dd00e/69769ca4-6a07-4aae-8cbf-0d666148c362)

![Screen Shot 2022-05-18 at 10.21.40 AM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/61e98ff375d0505e601dd00e/323642ce-1980-4b8d-926d-e5aea3e2f761)

**Expected results**
- Exiting "shared with" drop down menu by clicking anywhere outside, closes the menu but does not launch the goal card or any other action items
- Buttons on goal cards are cleaned up
- Delete button is moved down to the bottom of card and displayed in red
- Dates reduced to a standard size (3 letter abbreviation possibly), long arrow image is replaced with something more space-saving

issue.title: Review current public reporting spreadsheets
issue.body:
Public industrial emissions data currently lives BC Gov webpages. 

- [x]  Review [Industrial facility greenhouse gas emissions](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/climate-change/data/industrial-facility-ghg#:~:text=Data%20from%202020%20shows%20the,2e%20reported%20in%202019) (one file per year)
- [x]  Review [Provincial greenhouse gas emissions inventory](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/climate-change/data/provincial-inventory)

Definition of done:
- Understanding of the types of gases in the spreadsheets
- Understanding of the types of operations (LFO, SFO)
- Understanding of the kind of data available

comment.body: Hi @jaimiebutton - do you have any write up/documentation that provides a synopsis of the different reporting and how they align or differ?

  - When the field would normally not be empty for this entity type

issue.title: UI - Mhr Staff Payment Flow
issue.body:
When reviewing the flow for staff to complete payment with Scott, we found that flow implemented for PPR isn't the most intuitive for the MHR flow. 

- retain both free and client search buttons

1) Free Search for BC Registries Staff (MHR_Staff keycloak group)
- for free search option when client reaches review search results page changes are needed to the fee modal to show no fee. Right column should say no fee. If there is a quantity the price in the quantity section should be updated to $0.00. E.g. instead of 2 @ $10.00 each it would read 2 at $0.00 each

2) Client Search for BC Registries Staff (MHR_Staff keycloak group)
- when client search button is selected remove staff modal that is presented right away. Clicking client search should trigger search to complete so a user may view results and select those they wish to purchase
- on review search result screen add section under folio or reference number on screen to capture staff payment options (BCOL, routing slip, no fee). Use staff payment shared component.
- client must click 'Pay and Download Result' to complete search

Do not change the staff payment flow for PPR.

issue.title: onboarding for Sarah Elzinga
issue.body:
**Onboarding checklist for new team members**

This should be created at least a couple of days before a new member comes on board.


**IDIR**
- [x] Complete the form located at "R:\ARCS\HR 1300-1999\01 General\Onboarding Offboarding", which is stored on an internal drive and must be accessed by staff.
- [x] Submit to IT Operations Support. This form should be emailed to the Registries Executive Assistant. Currently this role is held by Michael Leung.

-----------------

**Legacy Applications**
- [x] Access to legacy applications is requested through the IDIR form listed above. This form should be emailed to the Registries Executive Assistant. Currently this role is held by Michael Leung.

-----------------

**Business Registry**
- [ ] Requests for access to any Registries applications should be sent to IT Operations Support.

-----------------

**GitHub & ZenHub**
- [x] 1. First, the new user is to go to github.com to register their account (using all lower-case for their name if it's a new account)
- [x] 2. Next, the new user is to verify that 2 factor authentication is enabled 
- [x] 3. Once the account creation and 2fa are completed, add an SRE and Priority label to this ticket
- [ ] 4. Comment on this ticket to indicate which project /team/product does this member need and move this ticket to the Priority pipeline on the SRE board
- [ ] 5. Once added, the employee will need to install the Zenhub plugin in the Chrome browser

-----------------

**RocketChat**
- [x] New user to download the RochatChat App and follow the instructions to Register a new account. (IT Operations Support will assign requests for access to the Business Registry to Relationships BA's (Melissa and Amit))

-----------------

**Meeting Invitations**
- [ ] The new team member has been invited to all of the required meetings and ceremonies

-----------------

**Business Context**

- [ ] Set up meeting for business context knowledge transfer
- [ ] The new team member's contact information has been added to the "Team BCR Overview" document https://citz.sp.gov.bc.ca/sites/SBC/REG/Projects/MVSM/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={5F6ECE64-702C-49BF-A02F-8B46ABF5B67E}&file=Team%20BCR%20Overview.xlsx&action=default
 
-----------------

**OpenShift**
- [ ] Required for developers, Patrick Wei, Kial Jinnah or Richard Armitage would advise the user to send a web access request through https://github.com/BCDevOps/devops-requests/issues/

-----------------

**OpenShift NameSpace Access**
- [ ] For developers and completed by Admin: Patrick Wei, Kial Jinnah, or Richard Armitage.

-----------------

**Google Drive Access for Knowledge Sharing Videos**
- [x] Read access to https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1tl3h0XnZZdlOR440CJjM-KHvvHgXCHoV (currently Linda, Maribeth and Trish can share this)

-----------------

**Ops Team Onboarding**

- [ ] Developers or BAs are added to Ops repo
- [x] Devekioers or BAs are given Edit permissions for the Knowledge Base (Ops Google Drive folder https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1KK_IFAdAJz9-d7rPwUYYoFXBOfBzqlZx?usp=sharing)
- [ ] BA have access to shared BA inbox
- [ ] Set up overview meeting with another Dev/BA to cover process and common requests (including review of the Knowledge Base and how to contriburte)
- [ ] Access to prod dashboard and databases (read-only for BAs to review client status for requests - SOFI, Namex and Business Registries)
- [ ] Set up meeting for training on an overview of each application and each DB. 
- [ ] If available, API testing training using Postman

- [x] Read access to https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1tl3h0XnZZdlOR440CJjM-KHvvHgXCHoV (currently Linda, Maribeth and Trish can share this)

-----------------

**Ops Team Onboarding**

- [ ] Developers or BAs are added to Ops repo
- [x] Devekioers or BAs are given Edit permissions for the Knowledge Base (Ops Google Drive folder https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1KK_IFAdAJz9-d7rPwUYYoFXBOfBzqlZx?usp=sharing)
- [ ] BA have access to shared BA inbox
- [ ] Set up overview meeting with another Dev/BA to cover process and common requests (including review of the Knowledge Base and how to contriburte)
- [ ] Access to prod dashboard and databases (read-only for BAs to review client status for requests - SOFI, Namex and Business Registries)
- [ ] Set up meeting for training on an overview of each application and each DB. 
- [ ] If available, API testing training using Postman
